search_locations.description: Search for locations on TripAdvisor. Returns up to 10 locations based on a text query. Supports filtering by category (hotels, attractions, restaurants, geos), phone number, address, latitude/longitude, and radius. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en).

inputs.searchQuery: string – required – text to search for (e.g., 'Eiffel Tower', 'Paris hotels')
inputs.category: string – optional – filter by category: hotels | attractions | restaurants | geos
inputs.address: string – optional – address text to filter results
inputs.latLong: string – optional – latitude and longitude in format 'lat,lon' (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060')
inputs.radius: number – optional – search radius (must be positive)
inputs.radiusUnit: string – optional – unit for radius: km | mi | m
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported: en, ar, zh, zh_TW, da, nl, en_AU, en_CA, en_HK, en_IN, en_IE, en_MY, en_NZ, en_PH, en_SG, en_ZA, en_UK, fr, fr_BE, fr_CA, fr_CH, de_AT, de, el, iw, in, it, it_CH, ja, ko, no, pt_PT, pt, ru, es_AR, es_CO, es_MX, es_PE, es, es_VE, es_CL, sv, th, tr, vi

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, FORBIDDEN, NOT_FOUND, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of location objects with details including locationId, name, address, category, rating, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

get_location_reviews.description: Get reviews for a specific TripAdvisor location. Returns up to 5 recent reviews ordered by recency. Higher limits may be available for beta access. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en), limit (5), and offset (0).

inputs.locationId: integer – required – TripAdvisor location ID (positive integer)
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations
inputs.limit: integer – optional – number of reviews to return (max 5, default: 5)
inputs.offset: integer – optional – index of first review to return (default: 0, non-negative)

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, FORBIDDEN, NOT_FOUND, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of review objects with details including rating, title, text, author, date, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

examples.title: Get reviews with language and limit

get_location_photos.description: Get photos for a specific TripAdvisor location. Returns up to 5 high-quality photos ordered by recency. Photos are available in multiple sizes: Thumbnail (50x50), Small (150x150), Medium (max 250px), Large (max 550px), and Original (full resolution). The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en), limit (5), and offset (0).

inputs.locationId: integer – required – TripAdvisor location ID (positive integer)
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations
inputs.limit: integer – optional – number of photos to return (max 5, default: 5)
inputs.offset: integer – optional – index of first photo to return (default: 0, non-negative)
inputs.source: string – optional – filter by photo source: 'Expert', 'Management', 'Traveler' (comma-separated, e.g., 'Expert,Traveler')

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, FORBIDDEN, NOT_FOUND, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of photo objects with details including URLs for different sizes (thumbnail, small, medium, large, original), caption, attribution, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

examples.title: Get photos with limit and source filter

get_location_details.description: Get full details about a TripAdvisor location. Returns comprehensive information including name, address, category, rating, ranking, coordinates, contact information, TripAdvisor URLs, amenities (for hotels), cuisine (for restaurants), features (for attractions), and pricing information. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en) and currency (USD).

inputs.locationId: integer – required – TripAdvisor location ID (positive integer)
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations
inputs.currency: string – optional – ISO 4217 currency code for pricing (default: 'USD', e.g., 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY')

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, FORBIDDEN, NOT_FOUND, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: object – detailed location information including id, name, address, category, rating, ranking, coordinates, contact info, TripAdvisor URLs, amenities, cuisine, features, pricing, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

examples.title: Get location details with language and currency

search_nearby.description: Search for locations near a given latitude/longitude on TripAdvisor. Returns up to 10 locations within a specified radius. Supports filtering by category (hotels, attractions, restaurants, geos), phone number, and address. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en).

inputs.latLong: string – required – latitude and longitude in format 'lat,lon' (e.g., '40.7128,-74.0060')
inputs.category: string – optional – filter by category: hotels | attractions | restaurants | geos
inputs.address: string – optional – address text to filter results
inputs.radius: number – optional – search radius (must be positive)
inputs.radiusUnit: string – optional – unit for radius: km | mi | m
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any (VALIDATION_ERROR, BAD_REQUEST, UNAUTHORIZED, FORBIDDEN, NOT_FOUND, API_ERROR, HTTP_ERROR, TIMEOUT, NETWORK_ERROR, UNEXPECTED_ERROR)
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of location objects with details including locationId, name, address, category, rating, distance, etc.
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

search_locations_by_rating.description: Search for locations on TripAdvisor and return them sorted by rating (highest first). Optionally filter by minimum rating threshold. This is perfect for users who want to find the best-rated places. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en). Results are automatically sorted by rating in descending order.

inputs.searchQuery: string – required – text to search for (e.g., 'pizzeria Napoli', 'hotels Paris')
inputs.min_rating: number – optional – minimum rating threshold (0-5). Only locations with rating >= min_rating will be returned (e.g., 4.0 for 4+ stars only)
inputs.sort_by_rating: boolean – optional – if true, sort by rating descending (highest first). Default: true
inputs.top_k: integer – optional – number of top-rated locations to return (1-10). Default: all results
inputs.category: string – optional – filter by category: hotels | attractions | restaurants | geos
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of location objects sorted by rating (highest first), optionally filtered by min_rating
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including min_rating, sort_by_rating, top_k
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

Perfect for finding the best-rated places near a specific location. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en). inputs.top_k: integer – optional – number of top-rated locations to return (1-10). Default: all results

inputs.radius: number – optional – search radius (must be positive)
inputs.radiusUnit: string – optional – unit for radius: km | mi | m
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any

outputs.data: array – list of location objects sorted by rating (highest first), optionally filtered by min_rating

get_top_rated_locations.description: Get the top k highest-rated locations matching a search query. This is the easiest way to find the best-rated places - just provide a search query and how many results you want. Perfect for queries like 'show me the top 5 restaurants in Paris' or 'find the 3 best hotels in Rome'. The function automatically sorts by rating (highest first) and optionally filters by minimum rating. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en).

inputs.searchQuery: string – required – text to search for (e.g., 'restaurants Paris', 'hotels Rome')
inputs.k: integer – required – number of top-rated locations to return (1-10, e.g., 5 for top 5)
inputs.category: string – optional – filter by category: hotels | attractions | restaurants | geos
inputs.min_rating: number – optional – minimum rating threshold (0-5). Only locations with rating >= min_rating will be considered (e.g., 4.0 for 4+ stars only)
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of top k location objects sorted by rating (highest first)
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including k, min_rating, sorted_by
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

examples.title: Get top 3 hotels in Rome with 4+ stars
Get top 10 attractions in New York

search_locations_by_price.description: Search for locations on TripAdvisor and filter by maximum price level. Perfect for budget-conscious users who want to find affordable options. inputs.category: string – optional – filter by category: hotels | attractions | restaurants | geos
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of location objects filtered by price level
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including max_price_level
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

search_restaurants_by_cuisine.description: Search for restaurants and filter by cuisine type(s). Perfect for finding specific types of food. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en). This function automatically gets location details for restaurants that don't have cuisine information in search results, ensuring accurate filtering. It intelligently limits API calls to maintain performance.

inputs.searchQuery: string – required – text to search for (e.g., 'restaurants Paris')
inputs.cuisine_types: array – required – list of cuisine types to filter by (e.g., ['Italian', 'French'])
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of restaurant location objects filtered by cuisine
outputs.search_params: object – parameters used in this search including cuisine_types, filtered_count, total_searched
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

get_multiple_location_details.description: Get details for multiple locations at once. More efficient than calling get_location_details multiple times. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en) and currency (USD). Maximum 10 location IDs can be requested at once.

inputs.location_ids: array – required – list of TripAdvisor location IDs (max 10, e.g., [60763, 186338])
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations
inputs.currency: string – optional – ISO 4217 currency code for pricing (default: 'USD', e.g., 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY')

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred (true only if all requests failed)
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: array – list of location detail objects
outputs.errors: array – optional list of errors for individual location IDs that failed
outputs.summary: object – summary including requested, successful, and failed counts
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors

compare_locations.description: Compare 2-3 locations side by side. Returns a structured comparison of ratings, prices, distances, and other key attributes. Perfect for helping users make decisions between similar options. The function accepts minimal input and auto-fills defaults for language (en) and currency (USD). Uses robust data extraction to handle various API response formats and provides comprehensive comparison metrics including highest/lowest/average ratings and most expensive/affordable options.

inputs.location_ids: array – required – list of 2-3 TripAdvisor location IDs to compare (e.g., [60763, 186338])
inputs.language: string – optional – response language code (default: 'en'). Supported languages same as search_locations
inputs.currency: string – optional – ISO 4217 currency code for pricing (default: 'USD', e.g., 'EUR', 'GBP', 'JPY')

outputs.error: boolean – indicates if an error occurred
outputs.error_code: string – code of the error, if any
outputs.error_message: string – description of the error in LLM-readable format
outputs.data: object – comparison object containing locations array and comparison summary (highest_rated, lowest_rated, average_rating, most_expensive, most_affordable)
outputs.summary: object – summary including compared and successful counts
outputs.suggestion: string – optional suggestion for resolving errors
